# becomeFirstResponder()

**Instance Method**

Notifies the receiver that it’s about to become first responder in its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow].

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func becomeFirstResponder() -> Bool
```

## Discussion

The default implementation returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], accepting first responder status. Subclasses can override this method to update state or perform some action such as highlighting the selection, or to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], refusing first responder status.

Use the `NSWindow` [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/makeFirstResponder(_:)] method, not this method, to make an object the first responder. Never invoke this method directly.

## Changing the First Responder

- **acceptsFirstResponder**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the responder accepts first responder status.
- **resignFirstResponder()**: Notifies the receiver that it’s been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.
- **validateProposedFirstResponder(_:for:)**: Allows controls to determine when they should become first responder.
